abstract.text: A light source described in terms of the variations in color and intensity of its illumination in all directions.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A light probe represents this variation either as a cube map texture or as a set of spherical harmonic coefficients. In addition to describing such light sources, the
class provides methods for generating light probe textures based on the contents of a scene and for generating spherical harmonic coefficients from a texture.
A light probe consists of two cube map textures, where each texel represents the color and intensity of light in a particular direction from the cube’s center:
cube map, also known as an
, contains a rendering of a scene as viewed from the light probe’s position. A renderer can use this texture to create reflections on surfaces with metallic materials.

cube map contains samples of the total light arriving at the light probe’s position from every direction. A renderer can use this texture to create diffuse lighting effects. You can derive an irradiance map from an environment map with methods on the
class, or when creating a light probe with the

Using cube map textures for light-probe-based rendering offers great visual fidelity, but adversely affects performance due to the cost of texture lookups during rendering. In addition, a cube map texture often contains more detail than is necessary for lighting. A set of spherical harmonic coefficients can represent the same information with less detail, and can be used in shader calculations with much less performance cost. To use spherical harmonics, call the
method, then access the generated data in the

abstract.text: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
A light source that illuminates a 3D scene from an area with a specific shape.
The abstract superclass for objects that describe light sources in a scene.
A light source described in terms of the variations in color and intensity of its illumination in all directions.
Generates spherical harmonics information based on the light probe’s irradiance texture.
Initializes a light probe with the specified cube map textures.
Creates a light probe representing the shading environment at a specific point in a scene.
A cube map texture that contains samples of the total light arriving at the light probe’s position from every direction.
A cube map texture that contains a rendering of a scene as seen from the light probe’s position.
Data containing the spherical harmonics coefficients for the light.
The number of levels of spherical harmonics information in the light probe.
Adopt this protocol to provide information for use in automatic placement of light probes around a scene.
The common interface for Model I/O objects that expose a human-readable name.
A light source whose shape, direction, and intensity of illumination are determined by a photometric profile.
A light source for use in shading models based on real-world physics.
A source of texel data to be used in rendering material surface appearances.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
